alert.note: Alert for Banks; Barrow; Cherokee; Clarke; DeKalb; Forsyth; Fulton; Gwinnett; Hall; Jackson; Madison (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 25 at 5:43PM EDT until June 25 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Cherokee County in north central Georgia... Barrow County in north central Georgia... Northwestern DeKalb County in north central Georgia... Southern Forsyth County in north central Georgia... Gwinnett County in north central Georgia... Southeastern Banks County in northeastern Georgia... Northwestern Clarke County in northeastern Georgia... Southern Hall County in north central Georgia... Jackson County in northeastern Georgia... Northeastern Fulton County in north central Georgia... Western Madison County in northeastern Georgia... * Until 615 PM EDT. * At 543 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Banks Crossing to Milton, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Gainesville, Lawrenceville, Winder, Jefferson, Commerce, Cumming, Danielsville, Peachtree Corners, Mountain Park, Sandy Springs, Roswell, Johns Creek, Alpharetta, Dunwoody, Milton, Duluth, Sugar Hill, Suwanee, Buford and Lilburn. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. If you see wind damage...hail or flooding...wait until the storm has passed...and then call the National Weather Service toll free at 1 8 6 6 7 6 3 4 4 6 6 or tweet us your report at NWSATLANTA.

area.areaDesc: Banks; Barrow; Cherokee; Clarke; DeKalb; Forsyth; Fulton; Gwinnett; Hall; Jackson; Madison
